$Transform MSC gameplay to MSC 7 (Signature) [Ferrer]
040015a0 40a00000		
040015a4 40a00000		
040015a8 40a00000		
040015ac 40400000		
040015b0 40400000		
040015b4 40400000		
040015b8 40400000		
040015bc 40400000		
040015c0 40a00000		
040015c4 40a00000		
48000000 8056a740		
de000000 80008180

de000000 90009340
18000030 800015a0
20090010 00000004
e0000000 80008000

48000000 8056a75c
de000000 80008180
58010000 00000324
de000000 90009340
18000030 800015a0
20090010 00000004
e0000000 80008000
* It means improved (a lot) all stats to just fastest passes, strongest shots, fastest movement, fastest acceleration, greatest defense... just a new gameplay to replay the game. It can works on online if both players use the same code


CODE EXPLAINED:
# First 10 lines of code write floating point values in the exception vector area, these values are the stats every character will have
040015a0 40a00000		# Write 5 at 0x800015a0
040015a4 40a00000		# Write 5 at 0x800015a4
040015a8 40a00000		# Write 5 at 0x800015a8
040015ac 40400000		# Write 3 at 0x800015ac
040015b0 40400000		# Write 3 at 0x800015b0
040015b4 40400000		# Write 3 at 0x800015b4
040015b8 40400000		# Write 3 at 0x800015b8
040015bc 40400000		# Write 3 at 0x800015bc
040015c0 40a00000		# Write 5 at 0x800015c0
040015c4 40a00000		# Write 5 at 0x800015c4
48000000 8056a740		# po = [0x8056a740]
de000000 80008180		# Check if po is between 0x80000000 and 0x81800000 (Check if a match is ongoing and character stats are loaded in memory). If true...
58010000 00000324		# po = [po+0x324]
de000000 90009340		# Check if po is between 0x90000000 and 0x93400000 
# 32bit serial code (NNN = 0x9, ZZZZ = 0x10, VVVVVVVV = 0x4): Writes 0x800015a0 at po+0x30, then increments 0x800015a0 by 0x4 and increments the address to write to by 0x10
18000030 800015a0		# ^		
20090010 00000004		# ^
e0000000 80008000		
48000000 8056a744		# po = [0x8056a744]
de000000 80008180		# Check if po is between 0x80000000 and 0x81800000. If true...
58010000 00000324		# po = [po+0x324]
de000000 90009340		# Check if po is between 0x90000000 and 0x93400000. If true...
# 32bit serial code (NNN = 0x9, ZZZZ = 0x10, VVVVVVVV = 0x4): Writes 0x800015a0 at po+0x30, then increments 0x800015a0 by 0x4 and increments the address to write to by 0x10
18000030 800015a0		# ^
20090010 00000004		# ^
e0000000 80008000
# At this point you get how the code works. It repeats the same process for each of the 8 characters that are playing in the match.
48000000 8056a748		# po = [0x8056a748]
de000000 80008180
58010000 00000324
de000000 90009340
18000030 800015a0
20090010 00000004
e0000000 80008000
48000000 8056a74c		# po = [0x8056a74c]
de000000 80008180
58010000 00000324
de000000 90009340
18000030 800015a0
20090010 00000004
e0000000 80008000
48000000 8056a750		# po = [0x8056a750]
de000000 80008180
58010000 00000324
de000000 90009340
18000030 800015a0
20090010 00000004
e0000000 80008000
48000000 8056a754		# po = [0x8056a754]
de000000 80008180
58010000 00000324
de000000 90009340
18000030 800015a0
20090010 00000004
e0000000 80008000
48000000 8056a758		# po = [0x8056a758]
de000000 80008180
58010000 00000324
de000000 90009340
18000030 800015a0
20090010 00000004
e0000000 80008000
48000000 8056a75c		# po = [0x8056a75c]
de000000 80008180

de000000 90009340

e0000000 80008000
